events.title: Armenian Genocide Begins
events.description: The Ottoman Empire begins the systematic extermination of its Armenian population, marking the start of the Armenian Genocide.
events.significance: This event led to the deaths of an estimated 1.5 million Armenians and is considered one of the first modern genocides, profoundly impacting Armenian history and international human rights discourse.

events.title: Foundation of the Library of Congress
events.description: The United States Congress establishes the Library of Congress.
events.significance: It becomes the research library that officially serves the United States Congress and is the de facto national library of the United States, preserving vast collections of knowledge.

events.title: Easter Rising Begins in Ireland
events.description: Irish republicans launch the Easter Rising in Dublin against British rule.
events.significance: Although the rebellion was suppressed, it galvanized Irish independence movements leading to the establishment of the Irish Free State.

events.title: Hubble Space Telescope Launched
events.description: NASA launches the Hubble Space Telescope aboard the Space Shuttle Discovery.
events.significance: Hubble provides unprecedented images and data about the universe, revolutionizing astronomy and our understanding of space.
